docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (Food Network)FAT CHEF A dozen chefs, whose love of food has brought them success and wealth but jeopardized their health, work with therapists, nutritionists and trainers to get their weight under control in just 16 weeks. In this series premiere Michael, left, a 36-year-old, 500-pound pastry chef from Long Island with a fast-food addiction, and Melba, an obese single mother who deprives herself during the day but binges at night, embark on a journey to lose 25 percent of their body weight with the help of the fitness professional Robert Brace. 12:15 P.M. (Cinemax) NEVER LET ME GO (2010) In this adaptation of Kazuo Ishiguro's dystopian novel, directed by Mark Romanek, three friends enter a cruel world. Kathy (Carey Mulligan), the film's narrator, calls herself a ''carer.'' Tommy (Andrew Garfield), the boy she loves, and Ruth (Keira Knightley), who steals him, are her friends at a boarding school where the children, watched over by Miss Emily (Charlotte Rampling), learn about their futures as organ ''donators.'' Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis said that the ''cruelty is done so prettily and with such caution that the sting remains light, giving the entire enterprise the aspect of a tasteful shocker.''

docs.abstract: The disappearance of 300,000 farmed Scottish salmon from their cages in a storm has left many wondering whether they will breed with wild ones and upset the gene pool.

docs.lead_paragraph: As if the Loch Ness Monster wasn't scary enough. Now, the Lox Ness monsters could be wreaking havoc in Scottish waters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lessons from Paula Deen on indulgence and its consequences.
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column asserts that food celebrity Paula Deen's announcement about having diabetes underscores how chefs and food celebrities often lead much more restrained lives and have more healthful diets than their public images would seem to suggest.
docs.snippet: Lessons from Paula Deen on indulgence and its consequences.
